intro: Pedicularis palustris var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered marsh orchid, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in northern regions. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs and marshes. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in early summer. It is a hemiparasitic species, relying on the roots of other plants for some of its nutrients.
